title: A 'green' initiative too far: why adding green number plates to electric cars is missing the point
text:
On the face of it, introducing green-coloured registration plates to electric cars could be a low-cost way of encouraging the wider public to appreciate the gradually increasing number of low- or zero-emissions vehicles on UK roads, as apparently happened during trials of a similar scheme in Ontario, Canada.

Whether you're a fan of EVs or not, government legislation is committed to ridding our streets of fossil-fuelled cars so why not let EV drivers display the green-hued number plates as a badge of honour, that they're "doing their bit" for the environment?

Because that, surely, is the only reason for doing so. The transport secretary Grant Shapps and his department appear to have forgotten...
